text: Nikolett Listár (born December 6, 1983 in Székesfehérvár, Hungary) is a Hungarian sprinter, her main events are 100m and 200m. * Team: Alba Régia Atlétikai Klub (ARAK), Székesfehérvár. * Trainer: Tamas Varga * Personal bests: ** 100m 11.71 Izmir 2005 ** 200m 23.19 Erfurt 2005 ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- | 2008 || World Indoor Championships || Valencia, Spain ||15th || 400 m ||55.37 |- |rowspan=4| 2005 || rowspan=2|Universiade ||rowspan=2| Izmir, Turkey || bgcolor="cc9966"|3rd || 100 m ||11.71 (wind: +1.1 m/s) |- | 8th || 200 m ||24.08 (wind: -1.0 m/s) |- |rowspan=2|European U23 Championships |rowspan=2|Erfurt, Germany |9th (h) |100m |11.82 (wind: -1.2 m/s) |- |bgcolor=silver|2nd |200m |23.19 (wind: +0.7 m/s) U-23NR |- | 2004 || World Indoor Championships || Budapest, Hungary ||10th || 200 m ||23.71 U-23NR |- |rowspan=2|2003 |rowspan=2|European U23 Championships |rowspan=2|Bydgoszcz, Poland |16th (h) |100m |11.86 (wind: 0.4 m/s) |- |6th |200m |23.68 (wind: 1.0 m/s) |- |rowspan=2| 2002||rowspan=2| World Junior Championships || rowspan=2|Kingston, Jamaica || 17th (sf)|| 100 m ||11.98 (wind: +0.3 m/s) |- | 10th (sf)|| 200 m ||24.10 (wind: +0.4 m/s) |} == References == *Nikolett Listár profile at all-athletics.com * *2005 European Athletics U23 Championships *2008 IAAF World Indoor Championships – Women's 400 metres *List of Hungarian Athletics Outdoor Championships winners (women) *List of Hungarian Athletics Indoor Championships winners (women) Category:1983 births Category:Living people Category:Hungarian female sprinters Category:Universiade medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Universiade bronze medalists for Hungary Category:Medalists at the 2005 Summer Universiade
title: Nikolett Listár
